meanings.definition: A person or company that helps to speed up a process or transaction.
meanings.sent1: The expeditor ensured the delivery arrived on time.
meanings.sent2: The expeditor at the shipping company made sure packages were sent out quickly.
meanings.sent3: The expeditor joked that they were the 'speedy delivery wizard'.
meanings.sent4: She was like an expeditor, magically making things happen faster.
meanings.sent5: The expeditor was like a superhero, swooping in to save the day with swift deliveries.

meanings.definition: To facilitate or hasten the progress of something.
meanings.sent1: He will expeditor the paperwork to get it done faster.
meanings.sent2: She expeditored the project timeline to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The team decided to expeditor their way through the obstacles.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to expeditor when they were having fun.
meanings.sent5: The expeditor's actions quickened the pace of the entire operation.
